page.title: 02FARMING IN GATESHEAD AREA
page.content: There are 8 farms in the region surrounding the three main areas of population,Marley Hill,the Causey and Kibblesworth.The farms were owned by Lord Ravensworth's or the Earl of Strathmore's families for many decades The National Coal Board bought land to extend its coalmining. Opencast mining took place at Old Ravensworth and Kibblesworth.Now most of the farms are owned and worked by individual farmers They are mainly small mixed arable farms which because of their size do not benefit from the European Economic Community.It is the large farms that really benefit because grants are paid on a percentage basis. Machinery is becoming faster and more powerful,so farmers can do more work in less time.One farmer,at least is using a computer to record calving times,mating times and milk yield.
